channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why has oil become the flashpoint in Trump’s campaign against Venezuela?
Bondi Beach attack: Does gunman Sajid Akram have family in Hyderabad?
Who is Bettina Anderson, Donald Trump Jr’s fiancée, who went viral in India recently?
From Tianjin to Jordan and now Ethiopia: PM Modi’s car diplomacy is catching on
Why BBC is now facing a $10 billion Trump lawsuit
What do Virginia Giuffre, Shafali Verma and Zohran Mamdani have in common? They are the underdogs of 2025
Bondi shooting: The ‘liberal’ world must smell the coffee and stop sugarcoating Islamist terror
item.description: The fixation on instruments rather than ideology — on hands rather than minds — has failed time and again. It offers moral comfort without strategic clarity and ensures repetition of terror attacks rather than prevention

item.title: How PM Modi’s Jordan visit anchors India’s West Asia strategy
item.description: For a nation seeking to deepen engagement across West Asia without becoming entangled in its sectarian politics, Jordan offers both accessibility and credibility

item.title: Gaza ceasefire set to enter phase two, but lasting peace requires enduring solutions
item.description: Finding the right set of Palestinian people to run the government and excluding Hamas leaders from any role is going to be a big challenge

item.title: Trump’s new foreign policy document is bad news for India
item.description: In the new US National Security Strategy, India’s strategic weight has undergone a drastic erosion

item.title: India’s strategic military environment in 2025: Managing power in an age of hybrid war
item.description: India’s military environment in 2025 reaffirmed a fundamental truth: future conflicts will be ambiguous, politically constrained, and psychologically intense. Success will not always look dramatic.

item.title: PM Modi in Amman: Exploring the multifaceted significance of India-Jordan ties
item.description: Jordan provides a rare case of political stability in the region, where the shifting sands can cause ripples with profound ramifications
